chunks.lyrics: Subject: TAB: At The Hundreth Meridian by The Tragically Hip
#This file is the author's own work and represents their interpretation
#song. You may only use this file for private study, scholarship, or
This piece is a great tune to jam to. Enjoy (Note: Both Guitars are in
Guitar 1 is dirty, Guitar 2 is usually dirty but also has a wah over it
G2 This section stretches out of the 4 bars for
G2 Chorus (Just bar chords... G2 is 1 octave higher than
That's all the guitar, now YOU just got to go and listen to the
to see what goes where (hehe I'm too lazy :) ) But here's the
And take my life in my hands?
A generation so much dumber than it's parents
A raven strains along the line of the road
I remember every single fucking thing I know
If I die of Vanity, promise me, promise me
that if they bury me some place I don't want to be
That you'll dig me up and transport me
away from the swollen city breeze, garbage bag trees
whispers of disease, and acts of enormity
and lower me slowly, sadly, and properly
Get Ry Cooder to sing my eulogy
9 Lingard Place \ miracles, it's that they're
Bishop's Falls, NF, CA \ reversible" Gord Downie
